description: Returns an array of ClusterDbRevision objects.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of response records to return in each call. If the number of remaining response records exceeds the specified MaxRecords value, a value is returned in the marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of response records by providing the returned marker value in the marker parameter and retrying the request. Default: 100 Constraints: minimum 20, maximum 100.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional parameter that specifies the starting point for returning a set of response records. When the results of a DescribeClusterDbRevisions request exceed the value specified in MaxRecords, Amazon Redshift returns a value in the marker field of the response. You can retrieve the next set of response records by providing the returned marker value in the marker parameter and retrying the request. Constraints: You can specify either the ClusterIdentifier parameter, or the marker parameter, but not both.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: A string representing the starting point for the next set of revisions. If a value is returned in a response, you can retrieve the next set of revisions by providing the value in the marker parameter and retrying the command. If the marker field is empty, all revisions have already been returned.

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the cluster.

nested_items.name: CurrentDatabaseRevision
nested_items.description: A string representing the current cluster version.

nested_items.name: DatabaseRevisionReleaseDate
nested_items.description: The date on which the database revision was released.

nested_items.name: RevisionTargets
nested_items.description: A list of RevisionTarget objects, where each object describes the database revision that a cluster can be updated to.

nested_items.name: DatabaseRevision
nested_items.description: A unique string that identifies the version to update the cluster to. You can use this value in  ModifyClusterDbRevision.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A string that describes the changes and features that will be applied to the cluster when it is updated to the corresponding  ClusterDbRevision.

nested_items.name: DatabaseRevisionReleaseDate
nested_items.description: The date on which the database revision was released.
